subject: Law
title: Impossibility and Frustration of Purpose
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Impossibility and Frustration of Purpose.

hook.text: You rented a balcony to watch a royal parade. The parade was canceled. Do you still owe rent?

buildup.text: Impossibility excuses performance when an unforeseen event makes it truly impossible to fulfill the contract.

discovery.text: Frustration of purpose applies when performance is possible but the reason for the contract has been destroyed.

twist.text: COVID-19 triggered thousands of frustration claims. Courts split on whether a pandemic was truly 'unforeseen.'

climax.text: The event must be beyond both parties' control and not something the contract allocated risk for.

punchline.text: When the world changes, contracts sometimes can't keep up.

quiz.question: What does frustration of purpose mean?
options: The main purpose of the contract has been destroyed
One party is frustrated with the terms
